item.title: FT Most Read: Friday, November 1, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. UK borrowing costs hit highest level this year as gilt sell-off intensifies
2. Trump says he will protect women whether they ‘like it or not’
3. Starbucks turns to Sharpies and price freeze to stem traffic slide
4. Closure of UK inheritance tax ‘loophole’ to penalise estates of wealthy pensioners
5. [Opinion] Why Kamala Harris will win
item.guid: FT Most Read: Friday, November 1, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
